uGaWS9lksF_f9u2JyRqikQ.text: I love this place! They have great quality sushi for a fair price. The people and servers are always friendly and welcoming. It truly is the best sushi in town.

x9RdDWdF1Z_ZAm_qPjWVjg.text: Great sushi! Seriously, I've been to so many different sushi places and this is by far the best. They don't have a license to sell alcohol yet but they are working on it and you can still byob. The Matthews Roll is a must have! 5 stars is an understatement!

mnonvEphpOWAwLBVwWqZcA.text: This place has great sushi! Very good selection. It's 20 bucks per person for all you can eat. Small. Quiant. Clean.

vE6690ZgRZCSqYaxe8NxCA.text: Great little spot in Matthews! Sushi is always fresh and plentiful. Can't beat the all you can eat sushi menu and prices!

uANJR_-A1N8nMkYEhBI7rg.text: 5 stars all day long. Listen. My wife come here every Sunday night. He have lived tons of places. New York. Chicago. New Jersey. You name it. We first joked coming here because it's like an old kfc turned it a sushi restaurant. But the waitstaff is amazing. We always have Val as a server and she so friendly and attentive. We do the all you can eat deal for $20 and destroy it. Majority of the time when other restaurant do all you can eat they add a ton of rice so you get full quicker and use fake items. Not here everything is spot on. Hope you try it out and we will see you on Sunday!!!

0WAAt5XL-tleaA74BAejNw.text: Please do yourself a favor and try this place out.  It isn't your standard all you can eat sushi that is mediocre.  It is very well prepared and it is EXCELLENT quality.  We are sushi connoisseurs and I will say that this is the best place in Charlotte for this type of meal.  The staff is extremely friendly and they allow you to BYOB until they get their liquor license as they are a new restaurant.  It's worth the drive to Matthews.

xAxYxhlqhBJCsn6DF_BZwQ.text: I've had my fair share of Japanese Sushi and Grill places that being said Umami is definitely one of the best. I have driven past it several times and thought about stopping and after I read the reviews online I decided I definitely had to give it a try. I started with the Gyoza or fried dumplings they were good, but the dipping sauce they came with was a little Bland, I then ordered the Hibachi chicken and beef, which comes with salad and soup you are supposed to get miso soup but they allowed me to change it out for the onion. it also comes with mixed vegetables for $11.95, I'm not sure what the sauces they use on the meat, but it is absolutely delicious when the plant first came I tried the rice and thought it's very Bland but then when I realized how delicious the meat was with the sauce and mix the two together, oh my goodness that was the bomb. if you happen to be around Matthews and you're in the mood for Japanese stop by Umami you'll be glad you did.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Sushi & Grill - Matthews, NC, United States. Onion soup and salad with shrimp sauce.
Photo of Umami Sushi & Grill - Matthews, NC, United States. Goyza (fried dumplings)
Photo of Umami Sushi & Grill - Matthews, NC, United States. Hibachi chicken and beef with vegetables and rice

AbXKBAkdHOjv5W7ztd320w.text: The all you can eat sushi is a great deal you get to pick the sushi you want. For only 20$ it doesn't look good from outside but don't judge a book by its cover the food is simply amazing.

IxGk4VJjzQDAp37uCDu8Vw.text: Stopped in to get takeout a few nights ago. This is a great little new spot and the hibachi dishes were good and reasonably priced. They even come with soup and salad which many other places charge extra for. I havent tried the sushi but probably will at some point.

i6mfjmGbuGu_YbTptijhzw.text: We have been there twice so far and love it! Had the $19.99 all you can eat sushi and apps. They have a great selection of food. They are doing a soft opening so be patient. The staff is friendly and food is excellent!

2e7qrx8m3gIrde5X8cNLPA.text: Closer to 3.5 than a full 4. Very friendly service and what seems to be a good deal for all you can eat, but an emphasis on fried options and standard rolls priced a bit above the quality of the fish.But pretty good for a fast sushi experience. They maybe just need to push in one direction or the other. Lower prices a bit for individual rolls or up the fish quality. I'll give it another shot though!

fC1GUSw1bgMBoeHKCEjODw.text: So glad this place is open! Great non-greasy hibachi. Tons of food for the price. Love it.

VAoPyXL8jpXEtE1FFnAAEA.text: We came here for Sunday lunch .. we ordered if the all you can eat sushi menu... their sushi is a joke .. I mean a joke .. you'll get better sushi at buffet ..  the only thing was good of the menu was the miso soup ... the service was friendly and fast .. but  food was bland and tasteless. I'm going 2 stars because the friendly service .. I feel like people who left them good reviews where either paid or family ...  there are way way better places for all you can eat sushi ... this is not one of them ........

kA6-Zj3l6N8I3W9IKwkeCA.text: Great little spot to get some sushi or a little hibachi. Very friendly staff.

cC_tDG26okceWaW7CrvUlg.text: Don't let the outside fool you! Very friendly service, clean inside and very good sushi. Fish is all fresh and their tempura is good. So attentive and fast. This is way better than the AYCE sushi place on Pineville-matthews road. Will definitely be back. Didn't have anything from the grill- will have to try that next time.

VOFFPZStqNW2uy74wgbogw.text: We LOVE this place!! Fantastic service, great prices, especially the all you can eat sushi (which includes apps, salad, soup, etc) which is always very fresh and delicious! Small scale family owned restaurant with great friendly atmosphere. We have been 5 times now and have not been disappointed! : )

AWK-_dwBEnM_lw8DJ9m8cg.text: Really excellent sushi.   Had about 5 rolls and 5 pieces of sushi.  All were great.  $20.   Wow. We will definitely come back.  Nice people, too.

-Bfc8yDfVUi3Uf8UQJm5Uw.text: Best sushi in the Charlotte area without a doubt. Extremely fresh fish and great selection of rolls. I highly recommend giving them a try!

mrtFjDlKTpw_PHDYEBe1LQ.text: Was a very good lunch. Fresh sushi, not like some places I've been. Great server. Not Super expensive, well worth it!!! And they have an all you can eat menu for $20. Will be back one night for dinner for sure. Almost forgot the excellent Miso soup and salad, make sure you get it with the ginger dressing!!!

Pfm35rWm2F5H_Ibk8FhcBQ.text: $20 all you can eat sushi?  Oh yeah!  It is made to order too (not sitting on a buffet all day).  Service was fast and friendly.  Tasty fish, great preparation and presentation.  Only downside: no alcohol.

vo5jBsA2fpNF9eN2RFfr0g.text: Ok so I came for the all you can eat sushi for $20 and that was amazing.  Their rolls are fresh and fantastic.  However, little did I know that they have some of the best hibachi I've ever had anywhere.  Let me tell you, the $20 AYCE sushi is a great deal and very hard to pass up, but their hibachi may be worth it.

VxgrCB46gNgl7HjlsTWmXQ.text: We LOVE sushi and Umami was awesome! Super fresh seafood, fast service, and very nice restaurant! The prices were very reasonable also, I got hibachi shrimp, the rainbow roll, and 3 pieces of red snapper. They have a all you can eat deal for $19 so I'll definitely be back for that!

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Sushi & Grill - Matthews, NC, United States. Rainbow roll and red snapper Nigiri
Photo of Umami Sushi & Grill - Matthews, NC, United States

37cW59kMgb8EKG8HRQQJdQ.text: This place is truly a gem. Quality sushi and all you can eat for 20 bucks so come hungry. I'm a big fella too so you best believe I got my money's worth outa this place! Some of the best customer service Iv had in a while. Even with me and my lady coming in a hour before close they were nice and friendly. Thinking about coming back for my birthday next month. Regardless, I will deffinitely be making this one of my new spots for good sushi, just awesome!

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Sushi & Grill - Matthews, NC, United States. Assorted nigiri

Ez1mOCvaE-ghgGYstV_0iw.text: Great sushi in Matthews! Nice atmosphere, love the dim lighting!! Great  very friendly service and the food is excellent. We will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Sushi & Grill - Matthews, NC, United States

2Rq4z5pDpOHXn9slBFC6sg.text: We did the all you can eat sushi dinner, and we really enjoyed the sushi! The rolls were very tasty, and the sushi itself was very fresh. The only complaint that I had was that the sushi came out at a very slow rate; we had to wait a long time for our second round of sushi. But overall great quality sushi!

7qodFko6UdjTFzQI_SCvxg.text: Outstanding service, $19.99 all you can eat sushi was delicious.  Best in town, will tell others about this place and will visit again.

-LHzaZQc9JB4OjfUq9kHLQ.text: Excellent! Very happy with our first trip here.  We had different kinds of hibachi and the all you can eat sushi. Everything was very fresh and made with an attention to detail. Even the sauces tasted fresh and delicious. The gyoza appetizers were some of the best we have had. The family that owns this restaurant is very nice. They made us feel welcome and were very attentive throughout dinner.  We will definitely be back!

-x8o7UsOQhxOU5hvCiWxvw.text: I absolutely love this place. I have never dined in and take my sushi to go but I'm sure you can't lose either way. The people are super friendly, the sushi is succulent (a funny word but it's True). They don't cut the sushi in gigantic pieces, so you can't chew or swallow. Their traditional sushi is almost bite sized and yet somehow it's still filled with soft, yummy ingredients. Their specials are bigger but not obnoxiously big. The Unami roll is one of my favorites. Give this place a try!

ljoI1idkjGBB-cb8OTphuQ.text: Great service and great food! The servers are attentive and the food is consistently good.  I also love the atmosphere.

xAUrkbP6bnu88PLbmMLoaw.text: I forgot to do this the day I went her but I love sushi but not at 25$ for 4 roll like gtfo of here with that bs bye Felicia I'll keep going to the other sushi place in Matthews for less cause your prices way to high you need to cut it

-aS5huZcCgt62gd-IaJjaA.text: Don't let looks fool you, although an old fast food building the food was great! Friday night, full house but no wait, service was great, food was a little slow but nothing to complain about. We will definitely be back!

40qtKsuMG5nfstYvqAEHGA.text: Very quick and friendly service! The sushi is very reasonably priced--- I got 3 rolls for $12. My sister ordered 2 rolls + sashimi. The sushi is very tasty and I love how it comes with soup and salad with no extra charge. The interior of the place is very modern and nicely done. Love it!

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Sushi & Grill - Matthews, NC, United States. 2 rolls + sashimi
Photo of Umami Sushi & Grill - Matthews, NC, United States. Spicy tuna roll, spicy salmon roll, and Boston roll

sqvRdrdcHOYv9epfpPsQGg.text: I wanted to wait till I have a few visits under my belt to write a review.  Umami has become my new favorite when it comes to sushi. If you love sushi the first thing you should order is the Matthews roll. It's over the top delicious. It's sweet and spicy. My favorite roll of all time. Not a fan of spicy? Try the Pop pop girl. It's got cucumber to cool off the palate.  Even the hibachi is on point and our little one loves the Miso soup.  My only complaint would be I wish I could eat more when I go but for all-you-can eat at $19.99 your first order will almost exceed that price.  Love sushi? Don't love sushi but like hibachi? Give it a try.  Just save the Matthew rolls for me.

08aUg53ZhL_QGCoDvDhsrw.text: The sushi is mediocre - nothing special, I would spend my money elsewhere. I had a bad experience the other day when the restaurant was completely empty and the waitress was extremely rude and didn't bring me some of the items I ordered.

XujfUqhPvTr6De8Hr-EskQ.text: Umami was good. I called in an order for beef hibachi and an order of spring rolls. Grand total: $15. My husband, daughter and I split the order and had plenty of food. The  miso is good. The meals come with soup, salad, veggies, rice and sauces. It's a deal that can't be beat.

9uc9d1EYotoScCvQWW-lJw.text: I am from out of state and was here on business. I am alway looking for a great sushi place. Let me tell you. This place is AMAZING. At first from the outside I was thinking otherwise but inside it's a lot different.  The sushi was fresh. And the service here was great. For $20 all you can eat.... I would be willing to pay 2X that. What a great find.

-syuwrUaxfdo4Cxp-dHoqw.text: Had this place twice already, I will say the customer service is always great. I ordered the hibachi beef (9.95) Spider roll(7.50), California roll (4.50) spicy tuna roll(4.95)and a regular tuna roll(4.95). Let's be honest, it's your typical Japanese style restaurant. It's a place where "you get what you pay for." I must say though -- the potions were surprisingly big and you also receive a miso soup and ginger salad.  They do offer all you can eat sushi for $19.99 (kids 3-6 $6.99 Kids 7-10 $11.99)  I do like the sushi bar they have, the decorations are Asian inspired. A sitting area while you wait for your take-out and a casual dining area. For the affordable prices that they offer I will continue to go here, but if you're looking for a not so plain/rainbows out of your rice Japanese meal, spend the extra bucks, skip this spot and see the other options.

3oO3Vm0BdcSu6mokInVGEQ.text: California roll-yum. Crunchy shrimp roll-yum, yum. I love the ginger as well as the Wasabi.  The spring roll was not greasy, hot and wonderfully flavorful. I also had a salad with a wonderful ginger dressing. The teriyaki shrimp was glorious. Lot of flavor in the shrimp and fresh vegetables. The rice was perfectly steamed. I love this place

40rQJkSK0e7xqrP_QeHogQ.text: My favorite place to get sushi in the area. They have a really awesome selection and they aren't too expensive! I've tried individual rolls and done the endless sushi. I thought both were really good! We've gotten hibachi from them a few times and haven't been disappointed.

yfXwh_Fjrmz3hGB_60aIoA.text: The food is amazing but my10 year old son got the all you can eat sushi for his birthday and didn't eat one ball of rice then ordered one more round the owner preceded to come out and tell us how we were being wasteful and wasting the cooks time because he didn't eat the rice under one of his pieces of sushi. Like I said food was great but the owner is an asshole.

HFfOqLka-TJ4wgCLwkmc3w.text: Great Hibachi... small restaurant but very attentive. We got the Goyza appetizer and the shrimp and chicken / Steak and shrimp hibachi.  As good as Nakatos but reasonably priced.    Restaurant is in what looks like an old IHOP location but has ample parking for downtown Matthews   Although we didn't try it we saw a table That was completely enjoying the "all You can eat" sushi which looked very good  Will definitely be back

Okt6diffF7rcmos1NBsJdA.text: Just gross!  The worst sushi I have ever eaten.  The tuna was terrible, it was old, gray, and reeked of fish that had been rotting on the shore all day.  The soft shell crab was so disgusting it literally made me gag.  All of the rolls were a weird sticky, chewy texture, there is literally nothing good about the sushi here.  Dont waste your money, I could have gotten a better sushi roll at the Chum Bucket.

CQXgxshiUOpS65XtjHIACQ.text: The miso soup is good. Typical soup.   Dressing for the ginger salad is very pleasant. It's creamy and the ginger isn't so much to where it's overwhelming like other Japanese restaurants around the area.  Vegetables entree is decent. I wished there were more mushrooms and if it had sweet carrots. The entree consisted of mostly broccoli, onion, green bell pepper, and mushroom.  A thing I wished they offered are sweet carrots. I love that they offer miso and salad with the entrees even when you have your order to go.   The sushi is one point. My husband who didn't like sushi became quiet the fan of Umami's. I would recommend teriyaki menu items as the sauce isn't too sweet. Habachi is great as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Sushi & Grill - Matthews, NC, United States

m6WbysEcBs2rauvQK8l0ew.text: This was a late night stop for sushi after a long day.  We were greeted by smiling, friendly faces at every turn. Service was spot on and the food was great.  We tried the hibachi chicken and the portion was insane. The all you can eat sushi for $19.99 was way more than I could eat!  The only thing was the sushi was a bit more warm than I cared for.  Otherwise, this is a clean, quick place for great food and great service.

IRO3TDAKG60vJ93mHHRD3g.text: 20$ all you can eat sushi.  I suggest the deep sea roll and the double spicy. Friendly staff, quaint atmosphere, I love this place

wW9JpyS8l2ceMkTkbs2PCQ.text: I came with my boyfriend and we got all you can eat. It's a little weird because you get charged 50 cents per piece you can't finish. I have been to Pisces and other places where as long as you order reasonable amounts one or two pieces does not matter. Quality was good for all you can eat and there were a lot of options for appetizers. The sushi roll options were limited and mostly fried. I would recommend for price but not for selection.

_dibgbERRZVwYS4FDSikwA.text: We have been there when they first opened and found it to be ok, nothing fabulous but ok. I have not been since February . My Nephew(14) had heard about it at school and wanted me to take him, so off we went to eat sushi. We went at lunch time and ordered from the 19.99 all you can eat menu. We had. Edamame Tempura Calamari & Shrimp..Both of these were frozen pre-made commercial products  Seaweed Salad..Which for some reason they doused in spicy mayonnaise   We ordered some rolls from the regular roll section and they came out. they were very loose, some couldn't even be picked up with chopsticks without falling apart.They don't use sticky sushi rice, but some other sort of non clumping harder rice. I would imagine this is used to accommodate the fried rice menu  We ordered a second round of rolls from the special rolls.  They came out again way over dressed with mayonnaise and various sauces. One thing that was missing was the actual crab from the fried crab roll, salmon skin was barely noticeable, the double spicy roll was just gooey on top , so much mayo inside that it was dripping and again they were all falling apart.  We ate what we could pull out of them and left the rest. This is when our MIA waitress appeared and told us if we didn't eat it we had to pay a surcharge , To me the best part of sushi is it is some what Healthy, when it's dripping with nasty mayonnaise it is not .Then the owner came over and yelled at us and told us we had to eat it or pay extra. I had been holding my tongue and didn't tell the waitress we didn't eat it because it was gross.  Now the owner ( which another reviewer called an asshole ) came and yelled at us, I tried to explain we found it pretty nasty and had we eaten it I would have vomited . He didn't care he yelled he made it this morning and it was good. He brought us the check with a 15.00 surcharge, our crappy all you can eat 19.99 lunch totaled at 63.47. For this we could have gone to a REAL SUSHI place. While  I usually use my debit card I charged this so I can contest the surcharge.   Summation If you want quantity over quality please go but if you want to be treated with respect, eat good food stay away

8ysQ0Z7GleR-7ql3GdzOKw.text: First visit today. Good and fresh sushi. I was pleasantly surprised at the great value for the delicious selection. The service was good and everyone was so polite. The building is an old KFC or other fast food place, but there is a treat hidden inside. I recommend the food and will be back.

8Xc_5d9_uIcMF4mJwhZIOQ.text: We stopped in for late dinner to kill our sushi cravings on a Tuesday night. Having just moved here from out of state, we were a little nervous about the quality of the sushi, but were pleasantly surprised! Our orders came out quickly, and the service was pretty good. The best part was that they didn't stuff the rolls with a ton of filler rice! Instead, the rolls were meaty and full of flavor. We will be back on our next sushi craving :)

3AwclbZ9ap9gX22Aj6L5Ww.text: The $20 ayce sushi option is the real deal. Very fresh, excellent. Service was prompt and friendly.

3ToRnG4WgPE52XQyaIXAvw.text: Good, fresh sushi. The prices are reasonable, and of course the all you can eat is fun too.   I love their lunch specials - sushi and hibachi. They're all fantastic!   I'll be going back for more!

XrBT4K417y1s2xnJ06cbHA.text: Sushi was very very bad. We ordered the Black Tiger and Spicy Tina rolls. It tasted like it had been sitting out all day. Could not finish it. Was sick for days after

qNi7HdDDChP9WGi4LiVuuQ.text: The food was just okay but the service was great. Plus the price is good for the lunch menu if you find that you enjoy the food. I had the umami roll, California roll, soup and salad for $10. The salad is iceberg lettuce with a sort of ginger dressing already on it. I didn't care for it but it was no big deal. The umami roll was ok but the California roll was pretty bad. Once again, the service was great so no big deal, but I probably would not go again.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Sushi & Grill - Matthews, NC, United States. Umami &amp; California rolls.

keYJPkageiutDdn5BdBNmg.text: Nice small restaurant, all you can eat sushi was very good and a great deal.  Good service.  And was pretty busy  even on a Wednesday night.

SY_IWjgpuLW4XxW33_cEHg.text: I LOVE this place already! Ive been here twice to dine in and also gotten take out twice. This place is brand new and the first couple of times i went in it was clear they were still figuring things out. However, there are clear improvements each time ive been here. The staff and owner are extremely friendly and accommodating. And the food is FANTASTIC. All you can eat sushi for $20 - you can beat that! (Also, kids get the full all you can eat sushi menu for $7!) I honestly cant say enough positive things about these guys!

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Sushi & Grill - Matthews, NC, United States
Photo of Umami Sushi & Grill - Matthews, NC, United States
Photo of Umami Sushi & Grill - Matthews, NC, United States

RZKLu43V930W_3oMsicm7g.text: This is probably my new sushi buffet restaurant. The waiters/waitresses are friendly, atmosphere is quiet and nice, and food to sushi ratio is amazing!! Would definitely recommend to my friends and family! Definitely would recommend the spider roll, it's great! Sushi doesn't take too long to come out as long as you order as you eat. Price is only $19.99 per person so it's pretty affordable!

VvXiwl1cFuh6RcsaNcupCA.text: This sushi is fantastic, fresh, and reasonably priced. It doesn't look like much from the outside but you'll be glad you stopped in!!

ym8uSJyeHQ6t3ZKAnU0IwQ.text: This is the BEST sushi I've ever had. Price is right, food is perfect. Simple, delicious. Just can't say enough good things.

WWmLEuQeSzVA4xZnXIJR_g.text: First things first we came in to this tiny hole in the wall not expecting much. We were greeted by am extremely friendly staff who explained pur options well. My inlaws ordered the teriyaki chicke and my family ordered sushi. All of the food was very fresh and exceptionally tasty. Dine here with comfidence that you will have a good meal.

zgy3V0YinK9SO1QIDZtISw.text: Friendly staff, awesome sushi and lots to choose from! I requested my sushi rolled in cucumber and even though it took a bit longer, they were willing to accommodate me. So thankful! I enjoyed every bite and will most definitely be back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Sushi & Grill - Matthews, NC, United States
Photo of Umami Sushi & Grill - Matthews, NC, United States. Spicy tuna and avocado rolled in cucumber. My favorite!

GnLRxc2nD_2uNcBogbZJWQ.text: Great little hole in the wall tucked in Matthews. While there is plenty of sushi in Charlotte, this quickly became a favorite because of the overall value. Solid staff, good fare at a fair price and easy walk ability to dine fun local sites.

IAQAnnVU-WthZWuvpOoqSA.text: Great choice if you like all you can eat meals. My date and I did not have AYCE this trip because he didn't want sushi and I wanted to try a roll that wasn't on the AYCE menu. The portions are typical of what many AYCE places serve. I enjoyed the sushi, and ate all 3 rolls by myself. I would return when I'm in the mood for a great sushi deal. But for a regular sushi night, I would go elsewhere.

Hh5j4u71X1jPrat8Q-AErw.text: Wow! I have to say that since coming to Charlotte, I have not found a single place that has wowed me in regards to hibachi. Umami definitely wowed me. While the outside of the restaurant makes me think this is a refurbished Burger King or Wendy's, the inside is nice enough. Servers are kind and friendly. The menu is not as large as I anticipated although you will find a wide variety of rolls if you are looking for yummy sushi. Fair warning, Umami has more fresh and tasty meals when it is busy. So you might wait longer for your meal, but it's worth it since it will be fresh. I have come here when it was empty and the food was not as on point as when I have been here when it's busy. Notably, they boast an all you can eat sushi menu, for the sushi connoisseur. It is $20 all day everyday. A few more dollars than other joints, but still a bargain for the amount of food.

1C97-kejvDOWF57dnbdcHQ.text: This review is not for the buffet. We just ordered regular menu but I would give 4stars for the all-you-can-eat buffet just paying $19.99. The roll I ordered was dragon roll and yes, the ingredients were fresh. But the portion of eel was so disappointing. You can hardly find eel, mainly cucumbers! (As you can see in the photo) Also they forgot adding masago on the top.   If I had this roll as one of the rolls for the buffet, I wouldn't complain but it was not good enough for regular priced roll. We talked the server and they were kind enough to change the roll. Another dish, teriyaki beef and shrimp was good. I can tell they use fresh ingredients. This place is good for the buffet but I will probably not order rolls for the regular price next time.

wivlidxT0KPvKiFuifZkjw.text: Good sushi , server was on my ass about eatting every single grain of rice or else they will put a surcharge on our bill... makes sense not to waste food but totally unnecessary. I felt her constantly hover around to make sure that we weren't discarding the excess food anywhere but my mouth, needless to say I finished everything but left with a bad experience.

HQkxGlOrL_sV26yCfhFIIQ.text: This place is pretty good! They've got a menu that includes everything I would want in an Asian food establishment: sushi, hibachi, edamame, etc. the decor was pleasant and the service was very nice! I found the bathrooms clean and the general vibe was okay.   The only reason I took off one star was because nothing was really impressive. The food was good, the service was good, and the ambience was good, but nothing really stood out.

_NEMeuWnuReT1RYYtunurQ.text: The food was good, definitely not the best sushi I have had. But what else can you expect when you get all you can eat sushi. We will be coming back. The one thing that surprised me was the small size of the appetizers, but that is not a problem because you can order more or you can try various appetizers. Sorry I did not take a picture of the all you can eat menu, it has changed slightly since the last photos were loaded.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Sushi & Grill - Matthews, NC, United States
Photo of Umami Sushi & Grill - Matthews, NC, United States
Photo of Umami Sushi & Grill - Matthews, NC, United States

66HCxMngz4JgsHkSo1AP0Q.text: If you're seeking sashimi, sushi and hibachi in the Matthews area, this is the place to go!    The restaurant itself is an old Pizza Hut that was "converted" into a Japanese restaurant.   The longest wait time was less than 5 minutes.  What continues to bring us back over and over again is the $19.99 all you can eat sushi. This is includes appetizers, deserts, sushi, sashimi including nigiri. The fish was fresh and the portions were generous.   If you have a family that includes young children, the menu also has smaller portion sizes suited to smaller tummies. There is a children's menu and there is also an option for children for all you can eat sushi based on age.

qQztHN3d5jpBFRwdFsNwuw.text: Very good food. I had the chicken and shrimp hibachi meal. The hibachi plate was cooked perfectly and the seasonings were were spot on. The miso soup and salad were also flavorful. I would have liked a larger portion size for the meat as it seemed more like a lunch portion than a dinner portion.   My dining partner had sushi. The rolls were beautifully presented, large, and well priced.  He was happy with his meal and very full after eating two rolls.   Unfortunately, they do not serve alcohol. I was hoping for plum wine, but no such luck. The lack of alcohol will probably keep this from being a True date night place, but we'll definitely be back for lunch.   We were impressed with the friendly staff and clean restaurant. The dining area is pretty and pleasant with lots of space. This is a much needed addition to the Matthews dining scene.  Edited to change to 5 stars, as we've eaten here 3 times in 10 days. Excellent food!

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Sushi & Grill - Matthews, NC, United States. Chicken, steak, and shrimp hibachi
Photo of Umami Sushi & Grill - Matthews, NC, United States. Salad and miso soup that comes with meals.
Photo of Umami Sushi & Grill - Matthews, NC, United States. Shrimp tempura roll and Philly roll

aAMWsrIN_j8oovJfJv6H6g.text: What could I say I keep on coming back. That should say enough  They have great Deal $19.99 all you eat They do have a special menu for this deal You can't bet it. Family owned and operated. The Mrs is always out front making sure everything is just so. And always so clean. This place you must come...

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Sushi & Grill - Matthews, NC, United States. Awesome job guys

dQ2-1IFWIQ8JihDtKSX7Yw.text: Sad experience this weekend when attempting to go to dinner. It was a Saturday night around 6:15 with several tables set and empty at the restaurant. A group of two walked in directly in front of our group of three. We were all generally greeted within about  30 seconds - great!  The group of two was seated within about a minute while our group continued to stand at the entrance...waiting to be sat. Several servers and what appeared to be hosts continued to walk by us. After an additional five minutes of no one greeting us, asking if we've been helped or any other dialogue, we left.   This was truly sad as I'd just explained to my group before arriving at the restaurant how nice the place is and how friendly the staff had been.   Unfortunately with several other nice sushi places nearby, I will think twice before returning to Umami.

iQf5L7JL-JvBcLZULelJcA.text: Don't let the converted fast food stand alone run you away. No it's not fancy but the food is good. Very fresh sushi, great miso soup, goza and seaweed salad. Have an all you can eat sushi menu  as well as a regular hibachi menu.   Parking lot, casual and family oriented.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Sushi & Grill - Matthews, NC, United States

tLgRj95KFpHCWb_dlf4gBA.text: The $19.99 all you can sushi is such a deal for the quality of food you get. The Crunchy Shrimp roll is outstanding and great Miso soup.

nS_ajtVQM6k00n8RU4B_NA.text: Great food and sushi and a great atmosphere too.   Our waitress was attentive as she would come and check up on us often.   The food came out in orderly fashion. We had lots of appetizers that were all good and actually came out first.   Three of us had all you can eat sushi which was more than we could finish but we tried very hard not to be wasteful. My parents and an aunt had food from the menu which was tasty too.   I think this place just opened not too long ago too. The only thing I would say is the rice is a bit excessive but as long as you try to finish you won't get any glares. Lol.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Sushi & Grill - Matthews, NC, United States. Kanki salad that was very good.
Photo of Umami Sushi & Grill - Matthews, NC, United States. Seaweed salad
Photo of Umami Sushi & Grill - Matthews, NC, United States

hUbcL1nAWPRXQ857zpwn5w.text: All you can eat sushi for $19.99 is perfect for anyone who loves fresh served to order sushi. It has a variety of appetizer options too. The miso soup is delicious! Come hungry, you will not be disappointed! For an extra charge, order the temporal ice cream, its a perfect ending to a great all you can eat sushi restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Sushi & Grill - Matthews, NC, United States. Toasty Roll that is deep fried with salmon, cream cheese and avocado
Photo of Umami Sushi & Grill - Matthews, NC, United States. Salmon sushi
Photo of Umami Sushi & Grill - Matthews, NC, United States. All you can eat sushi

xzj5_7W_3c7J43UmSsIbZg.text: Very nice and friendly staff. Sushi tasted fresh, spicy seaweed salad was great but not spicy, vegetable tempura was good and teriyaki chicken was flavorful. Will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Sushi & Grill - Matthews, NC, United States. Spicy seaweed salad. Good but not spicy.

KIwzs4v0oj7cmUs7ufEclg.text: This is a pretty good spot for sushi. Their sushi was really really good and tasted very fresh. I wasn't too impressed with the miso sour or the ginger salad, but amazing prices on their sushi lunch specials

UVbuzz-OkooAoaorhsimZw.text: This was so great. In town for work, used Yelp to soothe a mad craving for sushi. All you can eat sushi plus appetizers for 19.99. Totally worth it, totally recommend.

zvVozdfRVI6Hp_xj2Db7zQ.text: $19.99 AYCE. It's worth it, trust me. Unless you can only eat 2 rolls, in that case... who are you?? I wish that were me. I don't do all-you-can-eat sushi often because then I have to order and eat as much as possible to get my money's worth. I usually end up semi-regretting it. From the appetizers, I recommend the seaweed salad and calamari. Ordered a few rolls and enjoyed all of them. I like that they don't coat the rolls with too much rice so that you're just being filled up with rice. Do note that sometimes if you order many rolls, like more than 5, they will give you 2 pieces of each type of roll, maybe to save space for more? Someone who ordered more sushi than me ended up with almost the same quantity. I kinda wish they didn't do that because I know what I'm getting myself into and don't want to have to order another round after the first. Anyway, the service is prompt and friendly so I'll definitely come back if in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Sushi & Grill - Matthews, NC, United States

rza0rg3vROHr37Q1AnxkRw.text: The staff are all very nice.  The food is good - I can only speak for the hibachi as we have not had sushi here.  The hibachi and teryaki entrees come with miso soup and salad, fried rice, and vegetables.  The fried rice is good.  The teryaki chicken is good as well although I do wish the chicken wasn't so thin.  We frequently get take out from here and have never had any issues.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Sushi & Grill - Matthews, NC, United States. Chicken teriyaki (front) and hibachi chicken (back)

tgRHWE83ErM1Fsv2a9_9tg.text: Umami is a pure definition of don't judge a book by its cover. The outside looks like an old Burger King and the inside is basically left alone.. no major changes. The food though, it is consistently good and still one of the few sushi spots that has spicy crab roll with nothing else but spicy crab.  Their wine pours are heavy and prices are fair. One of my favorite sushi spots on the East side.

F6ONJ1-cYHdk9GGY6IjYWw.text: You had me at all you can eat sushi that is made to order.  My husband and I split the matthews roll, tricolor, and the crunchy shrimp roll.  We also ordered gyoza, edamame, and salad.  We had incredible service and everything came out quickly.   My husbands favorite was the matthews roll and gyoza and mine was the crunchy shrimp roll.   This location is in an old Hardee's building but redone.    We will be back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Sushi & Grill - Matthews, NC, United States
Photo of Umami Sushi & Grill - Matthews, NC, United States
Photo of Umami Sushi & Grill - Matthews, NC, United States

CGfBU_NbV2RulVaCCAomrw.text: I've always been bummed that my section of town has a hibachi shortage.  Luckily Matthews is not that far of a drive!  Umami has been on my radar for a while, I've just not had a chance to go there until I had a hankering for  hibachi.   They definitely delivered.  Came on a Sunday afternoon so it wasn't very crowded.  There was  a large table that just came from church (sorry just assuming here), but it's not a bad place to spend your Sunday afternoon in your sunday best.  I was there, bringing the ambiance down with my jeans and hoodie, but I was treated all the same by the staff:  greeted warmly, sat at a nice table in the atrium/greenhouse area... it makes me think that this building used to be a Shoneys for some reason, but unconfirmed.  I opted for the Chicken and Steak combo.  Comes with a salad and miso soup.  Everything was delicious and definitely a more unique hibachi style than I am used to.  The protein isn't cubed form but rather long portions - I think the chicken is probably tenderized and portioned out, but the increased surface area allows for more of the grill flavor and vegetables to infuse into the protein.  The veggies that come with the hibachi are usually after-thoughts, but here, they shine and are delicious.  Overall a GREAT hibachi experience and a TON of food.  I managed to down everything in one sitting, but it was after a long run and I was super hungry.

DpTjUddCVkD3_oG7prUsWw.text: Excellent service and very fresh sushi! Love the unlimited menu! Don't judge this place by the exterior, you'll be pleasantly surprised by the food that awaits inside...

CdN8ukfY2cK4HhfrD8dakg.text: This place is great! The service is always exceptional and the prices are good. The quality and presentation of the sushi is always excellent. I recommend this place to anyone looking for sushi in the area.

6Tp6cCqT_fFMzqdG--4-vg.text: Best sushi ever I go back all the time. Try the tuna tataki. Yummy I will always give great reviews on this place. There isn't anything bad about this place. You definitely want to check out this place and they have all you can eat sushi for 20. LOVE, LOVE Always.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Sushi & Grill - Matthews, NC, United States. So yummy.
Photo of Umami Sushi & Grill - Matthews, NC, United States. The best sushi ever
Photo of Umami Sushi & Grill - Matthews, NC, United States. Spicy tuna lovers

xv6ESA87m5fpkSiCKVWV0Q.text: It's awesome when you go to a new place with no expectations and are pleasantly surprised. Such is the case when we recently visited Umami. Kids pediatrician visit was over and we needed something quick and close by so we decided to give Umami a try. Very glad we did. I had the chef's choice sushi dinner and it came with a side salad and miso soup. Sushi was fresh and delicious. The family had a various assortment of noodles and rice dishes that did not disappoint. They had the tall silver Sapporo so daddy was happy.  If you are in the area and are craving some tasty sushi, you should definitely give Umami a try.

PVGIMSDgridsxrbjMFgUnA.text: Place looks better on inside than the outside. Food and service are good. Unfortunately, it is simply over-priced.

d3B97MWqND1boiRo4IdblA.text: Our waitress was sooo sweet, warm, and attentive. She customized my dish to meet my vegan needs and kept our drinks full. Large portions, plenty parking, scenic location. Would like to see more vegan and noodle dishes

ALh2k7uoGfn2LvdO2C5jiA.text: This is my favorite all you can eat sushi joint in the area. I have tried others but this one wins it for me. We are generally in once a month to indulge in our favorite sushi. They have other great dishes even if you don't like sushi. Everything I have seen and heard about has tasted great.

s4Xw1-SFLgRc-8asaZeLZg.text: Garbage don't waste your money or your time I just got ripped off asked for hibachi got garbage bag. Spent 56.00 should have been 20.00 do not waste your time with this place complete crap...

-iL9qeigAh-WlFJO7j3u5w.text: Okay Japanese food in downtown Matthews. We ordered takeout and they mistakenly gave me a vegetarian meal so we weren't impressed. However they said they would credit us when I called in and asked for a reimbursement. My husband had the chicken teriyaki and he thought it was average. I had ordered tempura chicken combo but they gave me vegetarian meal instead. I think I will give them another chance for sushi based on reviews.

OpWQhbEw48y0D3-fvq2t1A.text: This place has everything you would expect and want in a restaurant: quality food, good prices, good location, good atmosphere, good service. Food was excellent. They gyozas were amazing (sateued, not fried) and the sushi was also very good. We also had the miso soup, which certainly met expectations.  The only thing stopping me from rating a '5' is that they use imitation crab, so that limited our choices some. Otherwise, it is a '5' in all other respects (I wish a could give a 4.5!). We will definitely repeat!

h_wF2kka5YtQACpKeoQYZQ.text: All-you-can-eat sushi, made to order. Sure, there's a regular menu but if you're looking to stuff yourself silly with raw fish, the printed list is the way to go.  We got a couple hot items to start with - gyoza and such - and then a couple of huge plates of sushi. Tamago, eel, california roll, an Umami roll, spicy tuna, all that and more.  Service was great. No faces when we ordered more. No funny looks when we cleared one plate and got another plate. Woot.  Fish quality was good and the flavor was on. Definitely would return to Umami.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Sushi & Grill - Matthews, NC, United States. Umami Sushi &amp; Grill in Matthews NC
Photo of Umami Sushi & Grill - Matthews, NC, United States. Umami Sushi &amp; Grill in Matthews NC
Photo of Umami Sushi & Grill - Matthews, NC, United States. Umami Sushi &amp; Grill in Matthews NC

tsoFv5XaIFDrxNcAjbDgbw.text: Drove by this restaurant a few times because it's close to Carolina Beer Temple and I decided to go in because sometimes I just can't get over the craving of sushi! I walked in and was immediately greeted by a friendly waitress. Place was very homely and small (NOT in a bad way) and there were 12 tables MAX there.  I checked every box that I wanted under the blue AYCE menu and I realized that I had cemented my fate. I had to finish everything, but I knew I would. It took about ten minutes for the waitress to come back with the four different rolls I ordered and this made me super excited because a majority of other sushi places have me waiting close to 25-30 minutes!  Each bite of the spicy rolls and the ones dripping in spicy mayo and sauce gave me such a euphoric feeling that I couldn't help but smile at the window. I probably looked pretty weird to everyone else eating in there but I didn't care. I finished everything and thanked the waitress for being so kind and courteous to me!   Enjoy your five stars, I'll be back :-)

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Sushi & Grill - Matthews, NC, United States. Dining area :)
Photo of Umami Sushi & Grill - Matthews, NC, United States. 85% spicy, 15% I cant remember
Photo of Umami Sushi & Grill - Matthews, NC, United States. Chefs cooking up, chopping the eel and stuff

vvJJV7HAMhG_x1KR7YGfuw.text: I just stopped here with my family and to tell you the truth the place was phenomenal :) Great price point, fantastic service and tasted wonderful. We are already planning our next trips back

zaqfgmZGb0vNW5vPp4iBAA.text: We came on Christmas Eve for lunch and practically no one there so we had our food fast and nice service. They have normal menu and All You Can Eat with relatively good and fresh sushi place for the price. If you're a sushi fan, it's always better to do the AYCE for $20 because two normal rolls will be around $20 anyway. This was my first AYCE sushi restaurant - I started with the mushroom soup (that was excellent), had some clam, octopus, and squid nigiri (great and fresh), gyoza dumplings, then had a couple sushi rolls. Sushi was not the best sushi I've ever had, but the price is a steal especially if you're craving little things here and there. The rolls are full sized rolls and I wish they did half sizes so I could try more options. The only things I didn't like out of what I had were the egg rolls and I thought the sauces they had to pair with some of the appetizers were strange and didn't go with the meal. Overall pleasant experience

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Sushi & Grill - Matthews, NC, United States

lcOsyO6w0zJRIcMdwrNXcA.text: So, I really hate to post bad reviews, but I felt this was necessary to save others from the experiences my friend and I had.   First off, it should be noted that the staff was exceptionally friendly to use the 3 times we went, and the food is ok. Nothing great, but passable. Also, we had both been previous years and had good experiences, which is why we gave it another try.   Here is the issue. We got sick every time. Months apart.   The first time, I went last summer. Now, I chalked it up to "heat stroke" because I had sushi and then went out and walked back to work in the sun. I was very nauseated and had an upset stomach for about an hour.   Then, my friend went a month ago. She had the same experience. She felt extremely ill and was actually laying curled on the bathroom floor, but it resolved in a couple hours.  Then today, she decided to give it the benefit of the doubt and give it another chance. So, she went and had hibachi chicken. Sat there for about 15 minutes after on the phone and started to feel rough. She went outside to get in the car and ended up vomiting in the parking lot.   So, I am not sure what the issue is, perhaps contamination due to use of raw fish... but please exercise caution. I know none of us like food poisoning and I would hate for it to be a worse case next time.   *cough* salmonella *cough*  So, I don't wanna ruin their business, but I had to warn others.

x8MzulI6UbamM9O-Y7kW7Q.text: Umami is the best all you can eat sushi in Charlotte. It's a few dollars more expensive but the quality of food is much better than Mr. Tokyo. You cannot go wrong at this spot!

Y1F_ttTI9yXF8_-SDqaOuA.text: I've had the Tuna Poke bowl, and Umami Burrito. Both were delicious! The burrito was extremely flavorful with the Umami sauce. Chris suggested the Shishito Peppers as a side and it was a perfect meal!   This is going to be my new spot!  Now I can get my "Poke fix" without daydreaming about going to California just for a Poke bowl or burrito:)   Thanks for the excellent customer service and honest recommendations Chris!

HaEahcAAb2ZU5g8jMb24cQ.text: Love it here. We have been at least 10 times. Thankfully now serving beer and wine. It's a remodeled KFC so please don't go for the the venue but the staff and food are wonderful. My family goes for the hibachi but I enjoy the sushi. 10 out of 10 visits have been good to great. Great addition to Matthews.

wulvZqY2M4guXaxrp8fkXA.text: Stumbled upon this amazing restaurant. Very friendly people and pleasant music. They have an all you can eat sushi deal for $19.99. That is insane, and amazing! I literally got 6 rolls and they were all incredible and 6+ pieces per roll. If you love sushi, go here! Spread the word. :) This place needs more recognition, they rock!

hAY0xLzyv8G8ORxYJBz5nQ.text: My sister, mom and I stopped in to try it (mom and I Hurricane Irma evacuees , sister just moved here a month ago) and the food was excellent. The prices were very cost effective. We enjoyed our sushi and the service was excellent. The restaurant was very clean and eating utensils were very polished. Not my FL sushi bar i go to every Saturday but i loved it and i will def be back when i come ti visit.

F0IcpE_u1SlFbZLl5gMvjA.text: Went there on a Tuesday night and the place was very quiet (one table). But I know it is pretty new so I was still hoping for the best. I ordered three dinners to go. My chicken tempura was placed on the counter way before the teriyaki chicken and hibachi beef was ready, and it seemed like it was forgotten there. The hostess did then inform me that the chef had failed to notice the beef dish so I would have to wait a bit longer for the whole order. By the time I got home the tempura was ice cold and and not crispy at all. The other two dishes were ok but not anything to rave about. The place itself was clean and the staff was very friendly, I will probably give it another try but for now I was not all that impressed.

bc0gRkNKvmpmrTkx8nlPKQ.text: We tried this for lunch all you can eat sushi. Very fresh and tasty, okay price for a great concept! I recommend.

O_BEqOSt6f_DuFCqWA5_KQ.text: Wife, Kids and I went for lunch on Jan 2.  We had sushi and hibachi.  Everything was excellent.  Server was prompt, polite, and brought my oldest easy chopsticks without us having to ask.  The food was delicious, portions large for lunch, and well priced.  Dinning area was clean, spacious and well decorated.  We will be back.

UW1jwnuBF2XaSExfO18eIA.text: Nice atmosphere and all you can eat sushi! I had the teriyaki chicken w/ fried rice. Very good and the shrimp sauce is the best I have had. Legit. Wife had the sushi. Nothing but good things from her. Favorites were the Matthews roll and Crunchy Shrimp roll. I will definitely try the sushi in the near future. Also, service was quick and friendly. Check them out. I know I'll be back.

53UicjLeS1WKaHRKQ3sk5Q.text: I was very impressed with the quality and quantity of food. I ordered the hibachi beef and chicken. The service was great and the price as well. I will be coming back very soon.

MhAb9ZMM7PMsDzt_I2aOYQ.text: The heat wasn't working the evening I went for dinner (which in sure is fixed now) but the sushi was delicious! Everything tasted so fresh and had great flavor! Someone else with me had a hibachi chicken and shrimp plate which was also very tasty. Will definitely be back again and would absolutely recommend this restaurant to others!

FVFZ5ql3GCsyxaGakBE60Q.text: the grilled shrimp was cooked perfectly the sushi was fresh and tasty   service was well timed
